intro: Horkelia cuneata, commonly known as the Sierra bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. Horkelia cuneata is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
